title: How do teachers feel about remote learning? What are the pros and cons? - Quora

response.answer_text: About remote learning, most teachers would have a varied answer for its advantage and disadvantage. Remote learning has both pros and cons and it is a growing trend and a growing ubiquity for educational organizations as well as the students. Mostly owing to the pandemic situation, when the education system has completely changed and remote learning has stayed as the only method of learning uninterruptedly. Advantages of remote learning for education- Facilitates learning beyond the classroom hoursAdds flexibilityEmpowers students to learn through the use of technologyImproves interest and efficiencyInduces a more practical form of learningIncreases the scope of learningHowever, there could be implicit challenges which can pose as bottlenecks DistractionsMisuse of technologyLow productivityTime managementTechnological difficultiesEducational data security issuesetc Remote learning involves students to learn through various mobile devices like Tablets, Smartphones, laptops etc which are a major source of distractions and this requires effective management to ensure that students learn in a managed and secured way. Educational organizations take help of cloud solutions like mobile device management for education which allows IT admins to remotely manage and secure all students learning devices and helps protect organizational data and information on them. You can read this to know how MDM cloud technology helps in remote learning 5 ways MDM helps in remote learning and distance education

I taught online courses at universities. Doing so helped with department, school, and university numbers. My overall impression after 10 years is rather technical: It sucks. Students hated the lack of contact (although my actual cyber contact was nearly 4 times greater than in-class contact with the same courses). I hated not being able to assess in-person how well students were able to grasp or connect concepts. In all, I would never again agree to teach an online course. On the other hand, a few of my colleagues were more sanguine about their experiences.
